Coffee contains caffeine, a stimulant that can help increase alertness and reduce fatigue. When consumed, caffeine is absorbed into the bloodstream and subsequently transported to the brain, where it blocks adenosine receptors. Adenosine is a neurotransmitter associated with sleep promotion and fatigue. By blocking adenosine receptors, caffeine can promote arousal and help individuals feel more awake. Therefore, feeling more awake is the more plausible result of drinking a cup of coffee.

Strict regulations on tobacco usage aim to protect public health by reducing tobacco consumption within a population.
